Interface Searchable<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of object this interface can compare with
All Known Implementing Classes:
Course, GraduateStudent, Student, UndergraduateStudent
public interface Searchable<T>
A generic interface that defines search and comparison behaviors for objects based on a key or another instance of the same type.

Classes implementing this interface must define logic to determine:

  • whether the object matches a given search key (e.g., name, ID)
  • whether the object is considered equal to another object of the same type

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    isEqual(T obj)
    Compares this object with another object of the same type to determine logical equality based on the implementing class's criteria.
    boolean
    isMatch(String key)
    Determines whether this object matches the given search key.

  • Method Details

    • isMatch

      boolean isMatch(String key)
      Determines whether this object matches the given search key.

      This is typically used to implement keyword-based or identifier-based searches (e.g., by name, code, or ID).

      Parameters:
      key - the search key to match against (e.g., a name or code)
      Returns:
      true if the object matches the key; false otherwise

    • isEqual

      boolean isEqual(T obj)
      Compares this object with another object of the same type to determine logical equality based on the implementing class's criteria.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to compare with
      Returns:
      true if both objects are considered equal; false otherwise
